author: Nektaria Stamouli
title: Greek High Court Keeps Alive Case Tied to Debt Crisis
text:
ATHENS—Greece’s Supreme Court rejected judges’ recommendation that charges against the country’s former head of its statistics agency should be dropped, in another escalation of the yearslong debate about the origins of the country’s debt crisis.
The case file of Andreas Georgiou is to go before the Council of Appeals Court Judges for the third time. It will examine whether he should face trial on criminal charges of making a false statement and artificially inflating the country’s deficit, according to judicial officials.
